titleInfo.title: Speaking of Faith | The Religious Legacy of John Paul II

mods.abstract: John Paul II's papacy was dramatic and historic on many fronts. Speaking of Faith explores some of the critical religious issues of his 26 years as pontiff and discusses the great and contradictory impact he made on the Catholic Church in America and abroad. Host Krista Tippett speaks with NPR's senior European correspondent Sylvia Poggioli, priest and author Donald Cozzens, and Yale theologian Margaret Farley.

titleInfo.title: frontline: john paul II - the millennial pope | PBS

mods.abstract: This biography examines the life, character and legacy of Pope John Paul II. It probes the Pope's roots in Polish patriotism and Polish Catholicism, the Pope's rapprochement with Jews, the Pope's encyclicals on the culture of death and on faith,the Pope's stance on liberation theology and Pope John Paul's legacy and impact on the Catholic Church. This unique film biography of John Paul II also analyzes his implacable stands against contraception, abortion, married priests,the ordination of women and looks at the part he played in the fall of Communism.

titleInfo.title: RISU / Conflict around Autocephalous Orthodox Patriarchate Premises Continues:

mods.abstract: Kyiv� The premises of the Patriarchate Office of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church (UAOC), located in Kyiv, continue to be a source of conflict. The court ruled that the property, seized by a group of the supporters of Metropolitan Mefodii (Kudriakov), head of the UAOC, on 4 February 2005, be returned to the owners, including Archbishop Ihor (Isichenko), head of the UAOC eparchy of Kharkiv and Poltava, and the offices of the �Our Faith� newspaper. Attempts at regaining the property have been, however, unsuccessful, and �Our Faith� editor Yevhen Sverstiuk sent a letter regarding the situation to Ukraine�s Minister of the Interior Yurii Lutsenko on 14 April 2005.

mods.abstract: Voice of the Faithful is a Boston-based group formed in response to the crisis in the Archdiocese of Boston, and the broader difficulties afflicting the Catholic Church throughout the world. The group seeks to aid Catholic growth by providing a voice for the people of the church.

titleInfo.title: President's Statement on the Death of Pope John Paul II

mods.abstract: President Bush on Saturday said, "Laura and I join people across the Earth in mourning the passing of Pope John Paul II. The Catholic Church has lost its shepherd, the world has lost a champion of human freedom, and a good and faithful servant of God has been called home."
